# The `MemAlloc.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file defines counterparts of C library allocation functions defined in the namespace &#39;std&#39;. <a href="#details">More...</a>

This is an optimization pass for GlobalISel generic memory operations. <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This file defines counterparts of C library allocation functions defined in the namespace &#39;std&#39;.

The new allocation functions crash on allocation failure instead of returning null pointer.

The file content with the documentation metadata removed is:

<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Allocate a buffer of memory with the given size and alignment.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When the compiler supports aligned operator new, this will use it to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// handle even over-aligned allocations.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// However, this doesn&#39;t make any attempt to leverage the fancier techniques</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// like posix&#95;memalign due to portability. It is mostly intended to allow</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// compatibility with platforms that, after aligned allocation was added, use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reduced default alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#acbae7c06e77fa64145cca176963b6863">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NONNULL</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a33bc304d1e6e184f3ffd9fa1620fd14c">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;RETURNS&#95;NOALIAS</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a69fae8413f8fd4cea02237fe8b0c00ed">allocate&#95;buffer</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Alignment);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Deallocate a buffer of memory with the given size and alignment.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If supported, this will used the sized delete operator. Also if supported,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this will pass the alignment to the delete operator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The pointer must have been allocated with the corresponding new operator,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// most likely using the above helper.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6dd1aab3f9fa498fd6196a06fadbd984">deallocate&#95;buffer</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Alignment);</Highlight></CodeLine>
